item.title: Personal Notes on RNA-seq
item.description: 1 Overview 2 Trimming 3 Mapping 3.1 STAR 3.2 HISAT2 1 Overview Typical RNA-seq data analysis workflow: Trimming, i.e.Â removal of the adapter sequences and poor-quality nucleotides. Quality control checks help to indicate whether trimming has been carried out appropriately. Alignment to a reference genome Gene quantification and normalization with reference to a file containing gene positions (GTF file) Differential expression (DE) analysis across conditions 2 Trimming 3 Mapping 3.
